metadata.title: CVE-2013-7329 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The CGI::Application module before 4.50_50 and 4.50_51 for Perl, when runmodes are not specified, allows remote attackers to obtain sensitiveinformation (web queries and environment details) via vectors related tothe dump_html function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-application-perl - 4.50-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcgi-application-perl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.50-2').
